c# on phire heavy industries https://www.phireheavyindustries.com"/tags/c#/ Recent content in c# on phire heavy industries Hugo -- gohugo.io en Tue, 11 Aug 2020 00:00:00 +0000 Untitled C# AI Study https://www.phireheavyindustries.com"/p/untitled-c#-ai-study/ Tue, 11 Aug 2020 00:00:00 +0000 https://www.phireheavyindustries.com"/p/untitled-c#-ai-study/

This is an attempt to establish some sort of AI programming routines in order to classify strings of text as positive/negative or neutral. The objetive is to find if such a thing is possible with C#, how hard is it and what kind of resources will be needed.

Used Resources

ML.NET - Machine Learning Introduction

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X0DQjfW09kA&list=PLdo4fOcmZ0oUDTvk5XMNues09FnuB_D0u

Status

2020-08-20

It’s surprisingly easy. The worst thing about it is to get a reliable dataset. I have since experimented with two datasets and had more success testing the sentiment analysis in English, as the only dataset that i could find in Portuguese was for Twitter.

  1. Still to be decided is how can this be integrated with other apps or what other things i can accomplish with this.
Untitled MessageBoard API https://www.phireheavyindustries.com"/p/untitled-messageboard-api/ Mon, 10 Aug 2020 00:00:00 +0000 https://www.phireheavyindustries.com"/p/untitled-messageboard-api/

This is a project abandoned by a client but i have decided to finish it myself. It is a small social network oriented to allow users to comment on various topics or products. The objetive was to have several discussions rooms where one supervisor or admin would launch a topic of discussion and then he/she would create teams based on gender, age and location. The users would then be allowed to voice their opinions on the matter at hand. The best way to go about building such an app would be to have two separate components:

  1. A backend, in the form of a REST Api, built for this example in .Net Core 3.1 with Entity Framework
  2. A mobile app, built in native Android with Kotlin
  3. A SQL Database

The client decided that it would be simpler and faster to find something pre-made.

Used Resources

I’ve been following these tutorials:

.NET Core 3.1 MVC REST API

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fmvcAzHpsk8

Learn How to Build an Android 10 App - Using Kotlin - Development Masterclass 7+ hours FREE Course

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uRyvNKRkwbs

Status

2020-08-10
  • Backend is built and tested, although in a very basic form.
    1. It has no validation or authentication. And it probably never will, as this will be used for learning and proof of concept.
  • Mobile App has yet to be started.
2020-08-20
  • Mobile App is underway. I have built the first stages of an Android App, using Kotlin. Right now, i can access the API from the android emulator, and list data in a RecyclerView. This serves as proof of concept and will also enable me to copy and adapt the code for the users and messages sections.
  • Still working on:
    • Layout of the RecyclerView
    • Posting of new topics and new messages
Zenbreaker https://www.phireheavyindustries.com"/p/zenbreaker/ Tue, 01 Oct 2019 00:00:00 +0000 https://www.phireheavyindustries.com"/p/zenbreaker/

This was a simple experiment in Unity to better understand the mechanics of what it takes to build a simple game, including launching and publishing to the Play Store. It has since been abandoned.
